sectiondef.header: MQTT message IDs used for identifying subscribe message ACKs

briefdescription.para: The max JOB_ID_LEN according to AWS docs https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws_service_limits.html.
Construct the notify-next topic for receiving AWS IoT jobs.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.
If cannot fit in the buffer, which is assumed to be AWS_JOBS_TOPIC_MAX_LEN in size.

briefdescription.para: Construct the notify-next topic and subscribe to it for receiving AWS IoT jobs.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_subscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.

briefdescription.para: Construct the notify-next topic and unsubscribe from it to stop receiving AWS IoT jobs.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_unsubscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.

briefdescription.para: Construct the notify topic for receiving AWS IoT jobs.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.
If cannot fit in the buffer, which is assumed to be AWS_JOBS_TOPIC_MAX_LEN in size.

briefdescription.para: Construct the notify topic and subscribe to it for receiving AWS IoT jobs lists.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_subscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.

briefdescription.para: Construct the notify topic and unsubscribe to stop receiving AWS IoT jobs lists.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_unsubscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.

briefdescription.para: Construct the get topic for a job ID.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Job ID of the currently accepted job.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.
If cannot fit in the buffer, which is assumed to be AWS_JOBS_TOPIC_MAX_LEN in size.

briefdescription.para: Construct the get topic for a job ID and subscribe to it for both accepted and rejected.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Job ID of the currently accepted job.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_subscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameter is not valid.

briefdescription.para: Construct the get topic for a job ID and unsubscribe from it for both accepted and rejected.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Job ID of the currently accepted job.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_unsubscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameters are not valid.

briefdescription.para: Construct the update topic for a job ID and subscribe to rejected and accepted to receive feedback when submitting a job execution update.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Job ID of the currently accepted job.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_subscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameters are not valid.

briefdescription.para: Construct the update topic for a job ID and unsubscribe from rejected and accepted to stop receiving feedback from the job execution.

parameterdescription.para: Connected MQTT client instance.
Job ID of the currently accepted job.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If successful, otherwise the return code of mqtt_unsubscribe or snprintf.
If the provided input parameters are not valid.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct mqtt_client *const client, const uint8_t *job_id, enum execution_status status, const uint8_t *status_details, int expected_version, const uint8_t *client_token, uint8_t *topic_buf)
memberdef.name: aws_jobs_update_job_execution

briefdescription.para: AWS Jobs update job execution status function.

detaileddescription.para: This implements the minimal requirements for running an AWS job. Only updating status and status details is supported.

parameterdescription.para: Initialized and connected MQTT Client instance.
The ID of the job which you are updating.
The job execution status.
JSON object in string format containing additional information. Max 10 fields. Can be NULL.
The expected job document version. Must be incremented by 1 for every update.
This can be an arbitrary value and will be reflected in the response to the update.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If the update is published successfully, otherwise return mqtt_publish error code or the error code of snprintf.
If the provided input parameters are not valid.

detaileddescription.para: This implements fetching a job from the queue in AWS.

parameterdescription.para: Initialized and connected MQTT Client instance.
The ID of the job you are fetching use "$next" for fetching the next IN_PROGRESS. or QUEUED job. It will fetch the first created job if multiple exsists.
Buffer to store the topic in.
If the update is published successfully, otherwise return mqtt_publish error code or the error code of snprintf.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *sub, const char *pub, size_t pub_len, const uint8_t *suffix)
memberdef.name: aws_jobs_cmp

parameterdescription.para: Topic subscribed to
Published topic
Length of published topic
Suffix to match. Can not be NULL. Must be empty string for sub topics not ending with '#'.

simplesect.para: true if topics with given suffix match, false otherwise.
